data.title: Media centre
data.meta_description: Read our latest press releases about our work and the issues affecting children and families in the UK. Or contact our media team.
data.text:
Charity digital services sees 46% rise in demand for help with parental conflict

Support for parental conflict and relationship issues have seen the largest rise in demand from parents and carers seeking advice on Action for Children’s Parent Talk service.

Over half of UK parents fear no holiday or short break this summer due to money worries

New polling by Action for Children suggests the cost of living crisis is far from over as parents across the UK are worrying about how to feed their children or give them a summer break.

Challenges outside school gates impacting nine pupils in every class

New research from Action for Children reveals millions of pupils across England are falling behind their peers because of a lack of support for problems they face outside of school.

Statement from Action for Children on the charity's patron, The Princess of Wales

Action for Children sends best wishes to our Royal Patron the Princess of Wales and her family.

Action for Children responds to the Chancellor’s Spring Budget

Action for Children's Director of Policy and Campaigns, Joe Lane, responds to the Spring Budget. Learn how the Spring Budget will impact vulnerable children, young people, and families in the UK.

Working families on breadline would need to work eight days a week to escape it

New Action for Children analysis finds 300,000 low-income families with children trapped in poverty despite parent(s) working full time

Educational settings in Northern Ireland urged to help identify and support young carers

The Department of Education has partnered with Action for Children Northern Ireland to distribute a poster designed by Young Carers to all educational settings in Northern Ireland

More children in care could return to their families with better support, new research reveals

New research by Action for Children and the NSPCC has revealed that better support could see more children in England return home from care.

Sir Iain Livingstone named Action for Children Ambassador

Action for Children has named the former Chief Constable of Police Scotland, Sir Iain Livingstone QPM (Queen’s Police Medal) as its newest ambassador.

One in three children fear no merry Christmas for friend or classmate this year

New research also finds 2.6million UK children are facing a bleak festive season on the breadline

Now is the time to act: Leading children’s charities outline fundamental changes to reform children’s social care services

As part of the The Reimagine Children’s Collective, Action for Children NI and leading children’s charities outline the fundamental changes required to reform children’s social care services

60% rise in parents and carers seeking help for school refusal from Action for Children’s Parent Talk service

School refusal and anxiety has now become the number one issue for parents and carers seeking advice on Action for Children’s Parent Talk service.
